content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an example of how you can write this function in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks
    code_blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seed=1))
    
    # Remove the code fences and join the code blocks together with a newline
    joined_code = reduce((a, b) -> string(a, "\n", b.captures[1]), code_blocks)
    
    return joined_code
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find all code blocks in the markdown document and then removes the code fences from each block. It then joins these blocks together with a newline character, resulting in a single string of Julia code.
